szakacs.kpi.fei.tuke.arena.actors.pipe

Class Weapon

  • java.lang.Object
    • szakacs.kpi.fei.tuke.arena.actors.pipe.Weapon

  • public class Weapon
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing the weapon wielded by the player.

    • Method Detail

      • getBulletQueue

        public Queue<szakacs.kpi.fei.tuke.arena.actors.Bullet> getBulletQueue(PlayerToken token)

        Gets the Queue of bullets that represents the ammunition store of the weapon.

        Enqueueing and dequeing results in a bullet being loaded or fired, respectively.

        Parameters:
        token - the token of the player owning this weapon. If a value of null or an invalid token is passed, this method returns an unmodifiable view of the actual queue, meaning queuing and dequeuing results in an exception being thrown.
        Returns:
        the ammunition store of the weapon.

      • fire

        public szakacs.kpi.fei.tuke.arena.actors.Bullet fire(PlayerToken token)

        Fires a bullet, if there was one in the ammunition store of this weapon at the time this method was called and if the token passed to it belongs to the player owning this weapon. The result in such case is the same as getBulletQueue(token).dequeue(), otherwise null is returned.

        Parameters:
        token - the token of the player owning this weapon.
        Returns:
        the bullet fired if conditions hold or null otherwise.

      • load

        public void load(szakacs.kpi.fei.tuke.arena.actors.Bullet bullet,
                 PlayerToken token)

        Loads a bullet to the ammunition store if it is not null, the token passed belongs to the player owning this weapon and the queue is not full yet. The result in such case is the same as calling getBulletQueue(token).enqueue(); otherwise nothing happens

        Parameters:
        bullet - the bullet to load to the ammunition store.
        token - the token of the player owning this weapon.

      • getFrontIndex

        public int getFrontIndex()

        Returns the array index of the element at the front of the queue. Only used for rendering.

        If you are the player, just ignore this method.

        Returns:
        the array index of the queue front.

      • getRearIndex

        public int getRearIndex()

        Returns the array index of the element at the rear of the queue. Only used for rendering.

        If you are the player, just ignore this method.

        Returns:
        the array index of the queue rear.
